content: 2023 drama film by Jow Zhi Wei ***Tomorrow Is a Long Time*** ([Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 明天比昨天长久) is a 2023 internationally co-produced [drama film](/wiki/Drama_film) written and directed by Jow Zhi Wei. [Principal photography](/wiki/Principal_photography) began in end 2021 with filming taking place in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) and [Taiwan](/wiki/Taiwan). The film premiered as part of the Generation 14plus selection of the [73rd Berlin International Film Festival](/wiki/73rd_Berlin_International_Film_Festival), in which it is the first time a Singaporean feature film has been selected to screen in the section. ## Synopsis A widowed pest exterminator and his sensitive teenage son struggle with social and economic pressures which eventually leads to violent repercussions. ## Cast - [Leon Dai](/wiki/Leon_Dai) as Chua - Edward Tan as Meng - Jay Victor as Soe - Julius Foo as Lee - Lekheraj Sekhar as Kishod - Harry Nayan as Harry - [Neo Swee Lin](/wiki/Neo_Swee_Lin) as Wan ## Production *Tomorrow Is a Long Time* took seven years to develop and complete, with filming taking place in industrial zones in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) and in forested areas in [Taiwan](/wiki/Taiwan). Auditions for the role of Meng took around two years and newcomer Edward Tan was selected from 250 candidates to play the role. - *Tomorrow Is a Long Time* at [IMDb](/wiki/IMDb_(identifier)) This article related to a Singaporean film is a stub.
